notes.note: Prerequisite: EAS 1310 and EAS 1330.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Evolution of the Earth and Life

notes.note: Prerequisite: MATH 1110/1910
Prerequisite: Basic college math.
Prerequisite: EAS 1310; MATH 1110 or equivalent.
Enrollment limited to: Undergraduate standing in atmospheric science or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 2200 or permission of instructor.

Prerequisite: Enrollment in EES Semester in Hawaii, EAS 2200, EAS 3030, or permission of instructor.
For participants of the EES Program in Hawaii

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Field Study of the Earth System

notes.note:
Prerequisite: Enrollment in the EES Semester in Hawaii; one semester of calculus (MATH 1910/1920 or MATH 1110/1120) and two semesters of any of the following: PHYS 2207/2208 or 1112/2213; CHEM 2070/2080 or 2090/2080; BIOG 1101/1103-1102/1104 or 1105/1106 or 1109/1100; or equivalent course work.
For participants of the EES Program in Hawaii
Prerequisite: Familiarity with multivariate calculus (e.g. MATH 2930, 2130, or 2200, or equivalent); one semester of university physics.
Prerequisite: one semester of calculus and two majors-level biology courses or permission of instructor. Enrollment is limited to: EES semester in Hawaii.
Prerequisite: EAS 3410; Co-requisite: EAS 3420.
Prerequisite: Calculus and calculus-based physics courses or permission of instructor.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: European Discovery of Impacts and Explosive Volcanism

notes.note: Prerequisite: Junior, senior, or graduate students with background in geology or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: One semester of calculus, plus an introductory geology course or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 4530 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3520 and 4510.
Prerequisite: Math 2930, fluid mechanics or hydrology course.
Prerequisite: one year introductory biology and at least one of BIOG 1780, BIOEE 2740, BIOEE 3730, or EAS 3010, or permission of instructor.
The lab will be held at the Museum of the Earth. Transportation will be provided.
Prerequisite: Statistics and at least one physical science or calculus course.
Prerequisite: PHYS 2208 or 2213 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.

notes.note: Pre-requisite: Math 1920 or equivalent, college level physics and chemistry, junior standing or higher, or permission of instructor.
For participants of the EES Program in Hawaii.

course.course_title: Teaching Experience in Earth and Atmospheric Sciences

notes.note: Prerequisite: Calculus and calculus-based physics courses or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: MATH 2930 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3410 and 3420 or equivalent.
Prerequisite: EAS 4550 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: Multivariate calculus, matrix algebra, and two statistics courses.
Student may only enroll for 1 credit.
